summary: The year 1977 is significant in the context of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are payroll certifications for the HSCA during the months of September, October, and December of 1977. These certifications detail the names, positions, and salaries of the committee staff involved in the investigation of assassinations. The documents indicate the ongoing operational activities of the HSCA during that year, specifically concerning staffing and financial administration.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations
significance: The year 1977 represents a period of active investigation by the HSCA into assassinations. The payroll certifications provide a glimpse into the operational aspects of the committee, including the personnel involved and their compensation. While the documents themselves do not directly reveal specific findings or investigative details, they confirm the continued functioning of the HSCA during that time.
